ccg-setinfo.name: Strange New Worlds
ccg-setinfo.game: Star Trek Collectible Card Game: Second Edition

card.name: Charged-Particle Precipitation
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) The personnel who has the fewest [SD] icons is stopped. If that personnel does not have at least four [SD] icons, he or she is killed instead.

card.name: Code of Honor
card.text: Randomly select two personnel. They cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Honor or Law, Security, and Strength>35, all your personnel are stopped.

card.name: Coordinated Effort
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Unless you have twelve different skills, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Entanglement
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Your opponent may spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas during this mission attempt.

card.name: Financial Pitfall
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Unless you have 3 Acquisition or Cunning>35, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Heart to Heart
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Randomly select two personnel. If they share one or more of the same skills, both are stopped.

card.name: Meaningless Modifications
card.text: Unless you have 3 Engineer and Leadership or a personnel who has Cunning>6, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Molecular Reversion Field
card.text: Unless you have two personnel who each have Integrity>5, Cunning>5, and Strength>5, or have two personnel who have total attributes>38, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - You have 1 fewer counters to spend during each of your Play and Draw Cards segments.

card.name: Outmatched
card.text: Consume: X. (Your opponent chooses a number of cards to take from the top of his or her dilemma pile and places them face up beneath this mission.) For each dilemma your opponent consumes with this dilemma, add 10 Cunning to this dilemma's requirments. Unless you have Cunning>15, all your personnel are stopped.

card.name: Proximity-Actuated Field
card.text: Unless you have Biology and 2 Security or 2 Physics and Cunning>35, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may move up to two dilemmas from beneath one of your missions to another of your non-headquarters missions.

card.name: Psych Test
card.text: Your opponent chooses two personnel. Randomly select one of those personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Quarrel
card.text: Randomly select two personnel. Unless they have Integrity>11 or Cunning>11, both are stopped.

card.name: Small Problems
card.text: Randomly select three personnel. Each of those who is a {Cmd} personnel is stopped.

card.name: Stay Where Thou Art
card.text: Unless you have Cunning>40 or a personnel who has both Diplomacy and Integrity>7, randomly select three personnel. They cannot use their skills during this mission attempt.

card.name: Where No One Has Gone Before
card.text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Navigation, Physics, and Cunning>34 or Exobiology, Leadership, Medical, and Integrity>32, place this dilemma in your core and place your ship on this dilemma. At the end of your next turn, remove this dilemma from the game and place the ship at your headquarters mission.

card.name: Ferengi Computer
card.text: When a {fer} personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may place this equipment beneath your Ferenginar to prevent that.

card.name: Ferengi Whip
card.text: Hand Weapon. When you play this equipment, place the top card of your deck beneath your Ferenginar. While in combat, each of your {fer} personnel present is Strength +1. While facing a dilemma, each {fer} Treachery personnel present is Strength +1.

card.name: Brinkmanship
card.text: Plays in your core. While your {rom} Diplomacy personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to meet that dilemma's Integrity requirements using Cunning instead.

card.name: Delicate Negotiations
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {fer} personnel. Discard a card from hand to spend two additional counters this turn. Destroy this event.

card.name: Exceed Engine Output
card.text: Maneuver. Pursuit. Plays in your core. Order - Move your ship with your Engineer aboard to a space mission, then place this event on that ship. Damage - This ship is Weapons -2 and Shields -2.

card.name: Holodeck Grid
card.text: Plays in your core. You may play Holograms aboard your ship if both of them could be played at the same headquarters mission you command.

card.name: In the Pah-wraith's Wake
card.text: Pah-wraith. To play this event, you must command three {baj} personnel. Remove two events in your discard pile from the game to destroy an event in an opponent's core. Destroy this event.

card.name: Provoked Attack
card.text: Capture. Maneuver. Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement involving your ship with your Gul aboard. That ship is Weapons +2. If you win, you may name a skill and randomly select an opponent's personnel involved who has that skill to place in your brig.

card.name: Recover Components
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {bor} personnel. Take a personnel you own from your discard pile and place it on the top of your deck. Place this event on the bottom of your deck.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #6
card.text: Rule. To play this event, you must command three {fer} personnel. Plays in your core. You cannot spend counters to draw cards. (You do not need to spend all your counters during each of your turns.) Order - Stop one of your {fer} personnel to draw a card.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #22
card.text: Rule. To play this event, you must command three {fer} personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may discard three cards from hand to spend 3 additional counters this turn.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #76
card.text: Rule. To play this event, you must command three {fer} personnel. Plays in your core. Order - Return a Rule to its owner's hand.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #141
card.text: Rule. Plays in your core. When you do not command three {fer} personnel, destroy this event. At the start of each of your turns, if this event is beneath your Ferenginar, you may exchange it with a Rule in your core.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #144
card.text: Rule. To play this event, you must command three {fer} personnel. Plays in your core. When your {fer} personnel is facing a dilemma, you may take two cards from beneath your Ferenginar and place them in your discard pile to make that personnel gain any skill until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Seeing Double
card.text: Morph. Choose one: Place your Founder from your headquarters mission aboard a ship; or exchange any number of your {dom} personnel at your headquarters mission with an equal number of your personnel aboard a ship. Destroy this event.

card.name: Sonchi
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play an Anthropology Klingon, you may destroy this event to remove an event in an opponent's core from the game.

card.name: Temporal Incursion
card.text: Temporal Plays in your core. When the player on your right begins a mission attempt, you may flip your dilemma pile over to draw an extra dilemma. (Cards that were face up on the bottom of your dilemma pile become face down on the top.)

card.name: Tongo: Confront
card.text: Plays in your core. Order - Stop your {fer} personnel to make each player discard the top card of his or her deck. The owner of the discarded card that has the highest cost scores 5 points. (In the case of a tie, each tied player scores.) You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Vedek Assembly
card.text: For each Vedek you command, take a card from your discard pile and place it on the bottom of your deck. Destroy this event.

card.name: Worth the Price
card.text: To play this event, you must command two {fer} personnel. Destroy an event. The player who commands that event may draw cards equal to its cost. Destroy this event.

card.name: Ascertain
card.text: When your Drone is facing a dilemma, discard a card from hand and stop that Drone to replace all levels of any one skill in that dilemma's requirements with 2 Programming.

card.name: Clandestine Agent
card.text: When your Founder is attempting a mission, if your Infiltrator is present with an opponent's personnel, that Founder gains a skill of your choice until the end of this turn.

card.name: Clear Ultimatum
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {rom} personnel. Order - Examine an opponent's hand. Choose an event or interrupt revealed. That opponent discards it.

card.name: Cluttering Irrelevancies
card.text: When your Hologram is facing a dilemma, name a skill. That Hologram gains that skill and is attributes +2 until the end of this mission attempt. At the end of this mission attempt, return that Hologram to its owner's hand.

card.name: Delegated Assignment
card.text: When one of your unique {DS9} personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, stop two of your personnel present to make that {DS9} personnel present attributes +2 instead.

card.name: Impromptu Prison
card.text: When an opponent's personnel becomes stopped by a dilemma, you may discard two cards from hand to randomly select another personnel present to be stopped.

card.name: Means of Control
card.text: Punishment. To play this interrupt, you must have a captive. When your {car} personnel is attempting a mission, he or she is attributes +2 and gains all skills from that captive until the end of this turn.

card.name: Swagger
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {car} personnel. Order - Discard two cards from hand to destroy an event in an opponent's core that costs 3 or less.

card.name: Veiled Threat
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {fer} personnel. When your {fer} personnel is facing a dilemma, make him or her attributes +2 until the end of the mission attempt for each of these categories in which you have more than any of your opponents: cards in hand, events in core, and incomplete non-headquarters missions.

card.name: Advanced Battle Simulation
card.text: 2 Leadership, Cunning>33, and (Engineer and Programming or Navigation and Security When you play a Manuever event, if you have completed this mission, that event's cost is -1.

card.name: Advanced Combat Training
card.text: Leadership, Medical, Officer, Security, and Strength>34 When you play an Assault event, if you have completed this mission, that event's cost is -1.

card.name: Deliver Prisoners
card.text: Law, Leadership, Security, Treachery, and Strength>32 When you play a Capture or Punishment event, if you have completed this mission, that event's cost is -1.

card.name: Ferenginar (Financial Hub)
card.text: You may play {fer} cards, {na} cards, and equipment at this mission. When you place a card beneath this mission, place it face down. Dilemmas cannot be placed beneath this mission. Cards beneath this mission are not in play.

card.name: Investigate Destruction
card.text: Astrometrics, Diplomacy, Officer, and Integrity>25 or Navigation, Security, Treachery, and Cunning>28 Region: Neutral Zone.

card.name: Obtain Vaccine
card.text: Diplomacy, Honor, Security, and Cunning>30 Any affiliation may attempt and complete this mission with these requirements: Biology, Leadership, Security, Treachery, and Strength>32.

card.name: Protect the Escapees
card.text: Engineer, Honor, Navigation, and Integrity>25 You may attempt and complete this mission using your {kli} personnel with these requirements: Leadership, Officer, Treachery, and Strength>30.

card.name: Transport Delegations
card.text: Anthropology, 2 Diplomacy, Leadership, and Integrity>31

card.name: The Last Outpost
card.text: Acquisition, Security, 2 Treachery, and Cunning>36 or 2 Diplomacy, Leadership, Officer, and Integrity>31

card.name: Kira Nerys (Pious Major)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation When this personnel uses a skill to complete a {baj} mission, score 5 points. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Lenaris Holem (Bold Veteran)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer Bajoran Resistance. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if you have ten or more cards in your discard pile, you may meet Cunning and Strength requirements of that dilemma using Integrity instead.

card.name: Observation Drone
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}Medical Drone. When this personnel uses a skill to complete an {AQ} mission, you may exchange up to three cards in your discard pile with the same number of cards from your deck. Then shuffle your deck.

card.name: Reinforcement Drone
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Archaeology {SD}Geology Drone. You may play this personnel at cost +1 where you have three {bor} personnel present together.

card.name: Dejar (Cunning Saboteur)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Intelligence {SD}Science {SD}Treachery When this personnel uses her Intelligence to complete a mission, score 5 points.

card.name: Tekeny Ghemor (Prominent Official)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming {SD}Transporters Dissident. Legate. When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop your Dissident present instead.

card.name: Duran'Adar (Attentive Sixth)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Security Alpha. When this personnel uses a skill to complete an {AQ} mission, score 5 points. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Goran'Agar (Trusted Commander)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Physics While this personnel is facing a dilemma, each of your Jem'Hadar present is Cunning +1 Order - Stop one of your Jem'Hadar present to draw a card. You may only do this once each turn.

card.name: Omet'iklan (Steely Disciplinarian)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Geology {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer When you lose 5 points, you may place two of your Jem'Hadar present in their owner's discard pile to score 5 points. You may do this only once per turn.

card.name: Bruce Maddox (Chair of Robotics)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Officer {SD}Programming While this personnel is present with an Android, he is attributes +1 and gains Exobiology and Science.

card.name: Daneeka (Reassuring Physician)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Medical {SD}Science When this personnel uses Biology to complete a mission, score 5 points.

card.name: Dr. Leah Brahms (Holographic Representation)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Programming While this personnel is attempting a space mission, she is attributes +1 and gains Engineer.

card.name: E.M.H. Program
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Medical

card.name: Leonard H. McCoy (Remarkable Man)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Leadership {SD}Medical Admiral. While this personnel is attempting a mission, if you have completed no missions, each of your personnel present is attributes +2.

card.name: Michael Eddington (Loyal Leader)
card.text: {SD}Navigation {SD}Programming {SD}Security While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may make him attributes +3 and gain Honor and Leadership. If you do, he is killed at the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Montgomery Scott (Relic)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Programming {SD}Transporters While this personnel is equipped with an equipment, each dilemma he faces that requires Programming or Transporters is overcome and its effects are prevented.

card.name: Arridor ('Great Sage')
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Leadership {SD}Medical {SD}Physics {SD}Treachery When you begin a mission attempt involving this personnel, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a personnel, make this personnel gain all of the revealed personnel's skills until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: Birta ('Helpful' DaiMon)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law {SD}Navigation {SD}Security When you play an Acquisition personnel at this mission, you may examine the top card of your deck, then place it on the top or bottom of your deck.

card.name: Bok (Vengeful DaiMon)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}Officer {SD}2 Treachery Commander: Kurdon . While you command an event that has a higher cost than every other opponent's event, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Programming.

card.name: Borts
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Medical {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery

card.name: Brunt (FCA Liquidator)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Law {SD}Navigation {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery Commander: Audit's Spoils. Order - If an opponent commands more events in his or her core than you, return this personnel to his owner's hand to destroy an event.

card.name: Goss (Direct Negotiator)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Medical {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery While you have six or more cards in hand, this personnel gains Diplomacy, Transporters, and Treachery.

card.name: Gozar
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Archaeology {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery

card.name: Ishka (Moogie)
card.text: {SD}2 Acquisition {SD}Biology {SD}Honor Order - Examine the top card of your deck and exchange it with a card beneath your Ferenginar.

card.name: Kazago (First Officer)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer For each card beneath your Ferenginar, this personnel is attributes +1 (limit +3).

card.name: Kol
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Navigation {SD}Science {SD}Treachery When you play this personnel, you may place the top card of your deck beneath your Ferenginar.

card.name: Krunk
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Transporters

card.name: Leck (Eliminator)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Security {SD}2 Treachery Assassin. Order - Discard any number of cards from hand and return this personnel to his owner's hand to randomly kill an opponent's personnel present whose cost equals the number of cards you discarded.

card.name: Letek
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Geology {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery While you have a higher score than each of your opponents, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Medical and Treachery.

card.name: Lurin (Renegade DaiMon)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Geology {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Transporters {SD}2 Treachery At the start of each of your turns, you may discard a ship or equipment from hand to spend 2 additional counters this turn.

card.name: Lwaxana Troi (Telepathic Asset)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Telepathy Order - One of your {fer} Leadership personnel present gains any skill. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

card.name: Maihar'du (Silent Servent)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Navigation {SD}Security Order - Stop your {fer} Leadership personnel present to take a card from beneath your Ferenginar into hand.

card.name: Mordoc
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Security {SD}Treachery While you have more cards in hand than any of your opponents, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Transporters.

card.name: Nava
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Anthropology {SD}Geology {SD}Science {SD}Treachery When you play this personnel, you may take a card from beneath your Ferenginar into hand.

card.name: Par Lenor (Lascivious Emissary)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Geology At the start of each of your turns, you may destroy one of your events to spend additional counters this turn equal to that event's cost.

card.name: Quark (True Ferengi)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery When you play this personnel, you may download a card and place that card beneath your Ferenginar. This personnel is Cunning+1 for each Rule you command that has a different card title.

card.name: Rom (Younger Brother)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Physics {SD}Programming Waiter. When a {fer} personnel present is randomly selected by a dilemma, you may make that personnel attributes +1 until the end of the dilemma.

card.name: Skron
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law {SD}Programming

card.name: Sovak (Treasure Hunter)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Archaeology {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}Treachery Order - Discard a card from hand to examine a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the discarded card's cost, then replace them in any order.

card.name: Taar (Bristling DaiMon)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery This personnel is attributes+2 for each of these categories in which you have more than any of your opponents: cards in hand, events in core, and points scored.

card.name: Zek (The Grand Nagus)
card.text: {SD}2 Acquisition {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law {SD}2 Leadership Commander: Aurulent . Order - Stop this card to reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a {fer} personnel, draw it; otherwise, place it beneath your Ferenginar.

card.name: Jean-Luc Picard (Worf's cha'Dich)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Security When your Klingon personnel present is selected by a dilemma, you may replace him or her with this personnel.

card.name: K'Ehleyr (Diplomatic Advisor)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Law When this personnel uses her Diplomacy to complete a mission, score 5 points.

card.name: Aikido
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Physics {SD}Security When a non-Hologram personnel present is randomly selected by a dilemma, you may make that personnel Strength +1 until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: B-4 (Dangerous Simpleton)
card.text: {SD}Programming Infiltrator. While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may reveal three Androids from hand to make him Cunning +7 and gain Intelligence and Treachery. These effects last until the end of the mission attempt. You may only do this once each turn.

card.name: Calisthenics Opponent
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Geology {SD}Security This personnel is attributes +1 for each of your Security personnel present.

card.name: Flink
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Medical

card.name: Ira Graves (Noted Molecular Cyberneticist)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Programming {SD}Treachery When this personnel or your Android present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an Android from hand to prevent that. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Kivas Fajo (Collector)
card.text: {SD}2 Acquisition {SD}Archaeology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery Commander: Jovis. Thief. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may meet Diplomacy and Honor requirements of that dilemma using Acquisition instead.

card.name: Minuet (Jazz Lover)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology When this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may stop a non-Hologram personnel present to make this personnel attributes +1 and gain Programming and Security. These effects last until the end of the mission attempt.

card.name: Noonien Soong (Often-Wrong)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}2 Programming {SD}Science While this personnel is on a planet or aboard a ship, you may play Androids on that planet or ship. When you play an Android, you may discard a card from hand to download an Android.

card.name: Palor Toff (Trader)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law This personnel is attributes +1 for each Artifact you command.

card.name: Ruk (Old One Servitor)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Geology {SD}Security When you play this personnel, each Android you command is attributes+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Sigmund Freud (Father of Psychoanalysis)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Medical

card.name: Soong-type Android
card.text: While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may reveal three Androids from hand to make it attributes +4 and gain a skill of your choice. These effects last until the end of the dilemma. You may do this only once each mission attempt.

card.name: Tolian Soran (Renegade Scientist)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}2 Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Transporters {SD}2 Treachery When this personnel uses a skill, randomly stop one of your personnel present.

card.name: Varria (Lavishly Rewarded Aide)
card.text: {SD}Geology {SD}Honor {SD}Navigation {SD}Security {SD}Transporters

card.name: Vic Fontaine (Vegas Crooner)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor When you begin a mission attempt involving this personnel, you may discard a card from hand to subtract one from the total cost your opponent may spend on dilemmas.

card.name: Kassem (Stern Operative)
card.text: {SD}Intelligence {SD}Medical {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery When this personnel uses a skill to complete a non-{rom} mission, score 5 points. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Spock (Celebrated Ambassador)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}2 Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Science Dissident. While this personnel is present with a Dissident, each of your Romulan personnel present is attributes +1.

card.name: Tebok (Posturing Commander)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer You may play this personnel at cost+1 to reveal the top three cards of an opponent's deck and replace them in any order.

card.name: Audit's Spoils
card.text: When you begin a mission attempt involving this ship, you may take a card from beneath your Ferenginar into hand. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Aurulent
card.text: When this ship is about to move between a non-{GQ} mission and a {GQ} mission, do not add 2 to the span total of those missions.

card.name: Kurdon
card.text: While your personnel are attempting a space mission that requires Acquisition or Treachery, each {fer} personnel aboard this ship is Cunning +1.

card.name: Devoras
card.text: Cloaking Device. When an opponent's personnel is killed, if this ship is at the same mission, you may place a {rom} personnel from hand who has the same cost aboard this ship.
